intro: Oxytropis mollis, commonly known as silky locoweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and delicate, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, compound leaves and produces small, yellow to reddish-purple flowers in late spring to early summer. Oxytropis mollis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in regions with well-drained soils.
